CatDescriptText: Mrs. Judy Lott, school teacher, 416 Burrows Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 28, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "What do you think of race relations here in Pittsburgh?"  Aswer reads: "In comparison with other cities, race relations in Pittsburgh are poor. Fortunately, however, racial awareness doesn't touch the kids until they are about 11 or 12.  Younger school children get along extremely well.  I've taught at A. Leo Weil School and found that relations among the races were admirable.  However, here in Terrace Village 2, where they should be good also, race relations just are not."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Judy Lotto standing with arm on baby carriage, in Terrace Village public housing community
